alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 4:11PM EST until January 14 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Expect total snow accumulations of an inch or less in valleys and 1 to 4 inches at elevations above 1,500 feet. Localized snowfall amounts exceeding 4 inches are possible over the highest portions of Black Mountain. * WHERE...Bell, Harlan, Letcher and Pike Counties. * WHEN...Through 6 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions at the highest elevations where temperatures remain below freezing and will lead to slick spots developing. Conditions will gradually worsen at lower elevations tonight as snow showers continue and temperatures drop below freezing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heavier snow accumulations are expected to impact the higher elevation roadways including US-421 and US-119 crossing Pine Mountain, KY-160 and KY-179 crossing Black Mountain, KY-932 at Flat Gap, KY-38 at Morris Gap and KY-74 crossing the Log Mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state please visit http://goky.ky.gov.
